title: Paula Willamson wants a ‘quiet life’ with Charles Bronson after his release from prison
text:
Paula Willamson wants a ‘quiet life’ with Charles Bronson after his release from prison Soap actress acknowledges that her fiancé will ‘always be associated with violence’ Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Paula Willamson discusses her future with Charles Bronson Share this video Get celebs     
She’s engaged to marry Britain’s most notorious prisoner Charles Bronson . 
And now Paula Williamson has insisted that all she wants is a “quiet life” with the violent prisoner - but she admits his rehabilitation won’t be easy. 
“I’m fully aware that when Charlie gets out he’s going to be a target for people,” she told the panel on Loose Women today. 
“But eventually when he does get out we want to have that quiet life.” Paula Willamson discusses her future with Charles Bronson (Photo: ITV) 
And Paula revealed that she plans to be on the parole board with her jalbird fiancé later this year – to help secure his release. 
“I’ve got a belief I’m going to be on the parole board with him this year and he’s got a lot of positive things to bring to the table,” she said. 
“He’s locked up for 22 hours a day in a cage in Wakefield prison and I just want him to have the chance to work through the system.” (Photo: Rex) 
And when Charlie is eventually released, Paula hopes he’ll get a chance at rehabilitation. 
“I think it’s all relative and very politically correct to say once you’ve done your time that’s it even if he turns into archangel Gabriel,” she said. 
“He has plans to help young offenders not go down the same route but he will always be associated with violence.” Paula wants to have a 'quiet' life with her fiancé (Photo: ITV) Paula knows her fiancé's past won't go away (Photo: ITV) 
But despite her hopes for her fiancé’s release, Paula does accept that their marriage will have to happen behind bars. 
“It will have to happen behind bars and then do it again when he gets out properly,” she said. 
“It’s not the dream I thought of when I’m a child, I’ll be honest.” Like us on Facebook
